Key Match Events: Luis Arraez hit two doubles and a triple
The Padres jumped to a 4-0 lead in the first inning
Manny Machado ripped an RBI single
Jackson Merrill followed with another run-scoring single
David Peralta's RBI single made it 4-0
Corbin Carroll drew a one-out walk in the ninth
Robert Suarez struck out Ketel Marte and retired Alek Thomas on a groundout to end the game
Post-Match Reflections: Luis Arraez is trying to hold off Shohei Ohtani and Marcell Ozuna for the NL batting title
If Arraez wins, it would be his third batting crown in three years for three different teams, which has never been done in MLB history
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Padres secured the No. 4 spot in the National League bracket
They'll host a best-of-three Wild Card Series next week in San Diego
The Diamondbacks have lost four of five games
The Mets and Braves hold tiebreakers over the Diamondbacks should they finish with the same record
The Diamondbacks lost the season series to both teams
Yu Darvish's 203rd win ties Hiroki Kuroda for the most pro wins for a Japanese-born pitcher between the two countries
Others: The D-backs tried to rally in the ninth but were unable to score
Merrill and Peralta both had two hits
The teams play the middle game of their series on Saturday
The Diamondbacks will start lefty Eduardo Rodriguez
The Padres haven't announced a starter yet
